comments:
Created an attachment (id=83011)
log file for failed transaction

See the attached log. NIST repository returned document just fine.
This may be a NIST bug (not adding the content id on the return) ... but need more info to be sure.

There are two bugs here from two separate exceptions.

The root cause is a RuntimeException in:
java.lang.RuntimeException: ContentID is null
	at org.apache.axiom.om.impl.llom.OMTextImpl.getDataHandler(OMTextImpl.java:322)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.soap.B_XDSSoapClient.buildResponseAttachments(B_XDSSoapClient.java:160)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.soap.AbstractXDSSoapClient.send(AbstractXDSSoapClient.java:198)

This was some arcane Axis2 problem that has been fixed and committed (in B_XDSSoapClient.java).

===========================

The other is an ConcurrentModificationException being thrown when constructing the resulting error message in EMF:

[ERROR][Mesa12020.java:107] java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$EIterator.checkModCount(BasicEList.java:1378)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$EIterator.doNext(BasicEList.java:1332)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$EIterator.next(BasicEList.java:1312)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.consumer.B_Consumer.retrieveDocumentSet(B_Consumer.java:472)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.consumer.test.mesa.Mesa12020.test(Mesa12020.java:105)

Will investigate this further.
